revised_title: Reproductive Conflicts and Survival Prospects in Fire Ant Queen Associations
tldr: This study examines the factors affecting reproductive conflicts and survival prospects of fire ant queens in cooperative associations. The authors found that initial size differences and relative loss of mass between queens influenced survival, while the manipulation of queens' relative contribution to worker brood production did not significantly affect survival probability. The results suggest that workers may not be able to recognize and favor their mother queen.
